metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17090 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in chan_skinny.c in Asterisk Open Source 13.18.2and older, 14.7.2 and older, and 15.1.2 and older, and Certified Asterisk13.13-cert7 and older. If the chan_skinny (aka SCCP protocol) channeldriver is flooded with certain requests, it can cause the asterisk processto use excessive amounts of virtual memory, eventually causing asterisk tostop processing requests of any kind.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: asterisk package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.18.3~dfsg-1').
